STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 19, 2023
Kathleen SUZANNE Sperling
ARENAC COUNTY DHHS
3709 DEEP RIVER RD,
STANDISH, MI, 48658-9458
RE: License#: CP060200953
Dear Kathleen SUZANNE Sperling:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 05/18/2023 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency had 1 corrective action plan for the interim review completed 7/22/2022.
Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review were 327(5)(d)(6)(c) and
FOM 722-06B. The corrective action plan was received 8/17/2022 and approved
8/19/2022. There were no repeat violations identified as a part of this renewal
evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment involved a review of the corrective action
plan for the interim evaluation and an assessment of the effectiveness of the
approved plan. It also involved a review of the agency's key performance
indicators.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff were involved in both entrance and exit conferences. No
problem areas were presented by the staff.
The analyst interviews with youth were positive and indicated appropriate care and
supervision are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The building is well maintained and the records are maintained consistent with
licensing rule requirements.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert for a licensed foster home involving a pool and having
working door alarms. New alarms were installed and resolution was confirmed by an
onsite visit and picture documentation. Resolution was approved 03/12/2023.
Comments from caregivers and youth were positive indicating appropriate support
and supervision is being provided by the agency.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.

05/19/2023
